title: Fragment of a votive inscription(?)
support: Fragment of a marble plaque, with a projecting lower edge. Intact on right and below, preserving lower right corner, broken to left and above.

layout.p: Remains of three lines are preserved, with uneven right margin and one letter vacat at end.

handNote.lettering: Plainly cut letters without serifs. Omicron slightly smaller and raised; omega open with short horizontal tails; sigma with full length strokes, parallel top and bottom; epsilon with shorter middle bar.

date._: first century BCE or first century CE

provenanceFound._: Excavated in 2008 in the Parco archeologico di Lilibeo, in the area sacra of insula III, SAS VI, US 117

provenanceObserved._: observed on display 2023, no formal autopsy

repository._: Museo archeologico regionale Lilibeo Marsala - Baglio Anselmi

museum.name: Museo archeologico regionale Lilibeo Marsala - Baglio Anselmi
museum.description: Comprehensive collection of Archaeological material discovered at the site of Lilybaeum and in the surrounding area

bibl.author: Brugnone
bibl.title: Incontri di culture nelle epigrafi greche di Lilibeo
bibl.citation: Antonietta Brugnone, «Incontri di culture nelle epigrafi greche di Lilibeo», in Se cerchi la tua strada verso Itaca... Omaggio a Lina Di Stefano, a c. di E. Lattanzi e R. Spadea (Rome, 2016), 225–38
